University officials have admitted that the welfare provision for students with eating disorders is inadequate.

A new barbeque built in Donald Barron Court was vandalised last weekend.

B Henry's looks set to have its future confirmed for the first time in over 10 years with University officials set to confirm an increase in opening hours, Nouse understands.

A student from Halifax is pursuing legal action against a former housemate who has disappeared owing him and another housemate almost PS4,000.

The Apprentice York 2009 reached its conclusion on Saturday night, as Team mBezel took home the top prize of PS1,000 to split between its four members.

Bretts claims U-turn over censorship of online articles

Lewis Bretts, Democracy and Services Officer-elect, has denied that he plans to implement the censorship of online media archives, despite strongly voicing the idea.

The University of York has fallen to 11th place in this year's The Times Good University Guide.

The BNP have won a seat in the European Parliament representing Yorkshire, to the disgust of a strong anti-fascist movement on campus.

A controversial motion for the provision of gender neutral toilets on campus has been passed at a UGM meeting last week.

The GSA successfully passed their new constitution at their General Meeting last Wednesday.

University weathers credit crunch with minimal loss

The University of York has revealed itself to be in "a sound financial position" despite the recent economic downturn.

Survey reveals only 28% of York graduates expect jobs

The survey, based on interviews with 16,357 final year students completed last month at the University of York and 29 other leading UK universities, exposed that 34% of finalists plan to study for a postgraduate course.

University Challenge team ready for TV

Four York undergraduates are to face the task of defending the University's academic reputation on the popular television quiz program, 'University Challenge'.

The first four heats of York's Got Talent took place last week, in preparation for the final which will be held at Woodstock.

York Samba Band to play at the Ashes

York's samba band, consisting of people from York University's band Mendigo Surda and students from York St. John, is to play the Ashes this year.

YUSU have begun to prepare for the Supervisor of the Year Awards, which will take place in Weeks 7 and 8 with results in Week 10.
